measure.name: process_airflow
measure.description: This measure processes infiltration for the living space, garage, finished basement, unfinished basement, crawlspace, and unfinished attic. It also processes mechanical ventilation and natural ventilation for the living space.
measure.modeler_description: Using EMS code, this measure processes the building's airflow (infiltration, mechanical ventilation, and natural ventilation). Note: This measure requires the number of bedrooms/bathrooms to have already been assigned.

argument.name: userdefinedinflivingspace
argument.display_name: Air Leakage: Above-Grade Living Space ACH50
argument.description: Air exchange rate, in Air Changes per Hour at 50 Pascals (ACH50), for above-grade living space (including finished attic).

argument.name: userdefinedinfgarage
argument.description: Air exchange rate, in Air Changes per Hour at 50 Pascals (ACH50), for the garage.

argument.name: userdefinedinffbsmt
argument.description: Constant air exchange rate, in Air Changes per Hour (ACH), for the finished basement.

argument.name: userdefinedinfufbsmt
argument.description: Constant air exchange rate, in Air Changes per Hour (ACH), for the unfinished basement. A value of 0.10 ACH or greater is recommended for modeling Heat Pump Water Heaters in unfinished basements.

argument.name: userdefinedinfcrawl
argument.description: Air exchange rate, in Air Changes per Hour at 50 Pascals (ACH50), for the crawlspace.

argument.name: userdefinedinfunfinattic
argument.description: Ratio of the effective leakage area (infiltration and/or ventilation) in the unfinished attic to the total floor area of the attic.

argument.name: userdefinedinfsheltercoef
argument.description: The local shelter coefficient (AIM-2 infiltration model) accounts for nearby buildings, trees and obstructions.

argument.name: userdefinedhomeage
argument.description: Age of home [Enter 0 for New Construction].

argument.name: selectedterraintype
argument.description: The terrain of the site.

argument.name: selectedinfilcredit
argument.description: Defines whether the infiltration credit allowed per the ASHRAE 62.2 Standard will be included in the calculation of the mechanical ventilation rate. If True, the infiltration credit will apply 1) to new/existing single-family detached homes for 2013 ASHRAE 62.2, or 2) to existing single-family detached or multi-family homes for 2010 ASHRAE 62.2.

argument.name: userdefinedtotaleff
argument.description: The net total energy (sensible plus latent, also called enthalpy) recovered by the supply airstream adjusted by electric consumption, case heat loss or heat gain, air leakage and airflow mass imbalance between the two airstreams, as a percent of the potential total energy that could be recovered plus the exhaust fan energy.

argument.name: userdefinedsenseff
argument.description: The net sensible energy recovered by the supply airstream as adjusted by electric consumption, case heat loss or heat gain, air leakage, airflow mass imbalance between the two airstreams and the energy used for defrost (when running the Very Low Temperature Test), as a percent of the potential sensible energy that could be recovered plus the exhaust fan energy.

argument.name: userdefinedfanpower
argument.description: Fan power (in W) per delivered airflow rate (in cfm) of fan(s) providing whole house ventilation. If the house uses a balanced ventilation system there is assumed to be two fans operating at this efficiency.

argument.name: userdefinedfracofashrae
argument.description: Fraction of the ventilation rate (including any infiltration credit) specified by ASHRAE 62.2 that is desired in the building.

argument.name: selectedashraestandard
argument.description: Specifies which version (year) of the ASHRAE 62.2 Standard should be used.

argument.name: userdefineddryerexhaust
argument.description: Rated flow capacity of the clothes dryer exhaust. This fan is assumed to run 60 min/day between 11am and 12pm.

argument.name: userdefinedhtgoffset
argument.display_name: Natural Ventilation: Heating Season Setpoint Offset
argument.description: The temperature offset below the hourly cooling setpoint, to which the living space is allowed to cool during months that are only in the heating season.

argument.name: userdefinedclgoffset
argument.display_name: Natural Ventilation: Cooling Season Setpoint Offset
argument.description: The temperature offset above the hourly heating setpoint, to which the living space is allowed to cool during months that are only in the cooling season.

argument.name: userdefinedovlpoffset
argument.display_name: Natural Ventilation: Overlap Season Setpoint Offset
argument.description: The temperature offset above the maximum heating setpoint, to which the living space is allowed to cool during months that are in both the heating season and cooling season.

argument.name: selectedheatingssn
argument.description: True if windows are allowed to be opened during months that are only in the heating season.

argument.name: selectedcoolingssn
argument.description: True if windows are allowed to be opened during months that are only in the cooling season.

argument.name: selectedoverlapssn
argument.description: True if windows are allowed to be opened during months that are in both the heating season and cooling season.

argument.name: userdefinedventweekdays
argument.description: Number of weekdays in the week that natural ventilation can occur.

argument.name: userdefinedventweekenddays
argument.description: Number of weekend days in the week that natural ventilation can occur.

argument.name: userdefinedfracwinopen
argument.display_name: Natural Ventilation: Fraction of Openable Windows Open
argument.description: Specifies the fraction of the total openable window area in the building that is opened for ventilation.

argument.name: userdefinedfracwinareaopen
argument.display_name: Natural Ventilation: Fraction Window Area Openable
argument.description: Specifies the fraction of total window area in the home that can be opened (e.g. typical sliding windows can be opened to half of their area).

argument.name: userdefinedhumratio
argument.display_name: Natural Ventilation: Max OA Humidity Ratio
argument.description: Outdoor air humidity ratio above which windows will not open for natural ventilation.

argument.name: userdefinedrelhumratio
argument.display_name: Natural Ventilation: Max OA Relative Humidity
argument.description: Outdoor air relative humidity (0-1) above which windows will not open for natural ventilation.

argument.name: duct_location
argument.description: The space with the primary location of ducts.

argument.name: duct_total_leakage
argument.description: The total amount of air flow leakage expressed as a fraction of the total air flow rate.

argument.name: duct_sup_frac
argument.display_name: Ducts: Supply Leakage Fraction of Total
argument.description: The amount of air flow leakage leaking out from the supply duct expressed as a fraction of the total duct leakage.

argument.name: duct_ret_frac
argument.display_name: Ducts: Return Leakage Fraction of Total
argument.description: The amount of air flow leakage leaking into the return duct expressed as a fraction of the total duct leakage.

argument.name: duct_ah_sup_frac
argument.display_name: Ducts: Supply Air Handler Leakage Fraction of Total
argument.description: The amount of air flow leakage leaking out from the supply-side of the air handler expressed as a fraction of the total duct leakage.

argument.name: duct_ah_ret_frac
argument.display_name: Ducts: Return Air Handler Leakage Fraction of Total
argument.description: The amount of air flow leakage leaking out from the return-side of the air handler expressed as a fraction of the total duct leakage.

argument.name: duct_norm_leakage_to_outside
argument.description: Normalized leakage to the outside when tested at a pressure differential of 25 Pascals (0.1 inches w.g.) across the system.

argument.name: duct_location_frac
argument.description: Fraction of supply ducts in the space specified by Duct Location; the remainder of supply ducts will be located in above-grade conditioned space.

argument.name: duct_num_returns
argument.description: The number of duct returns.

argument.name: supply_surface_area_multiplier
argument.description: Values specify a fraction of the Building America Benchmark supply duct surface area.

argument.name: return_surface_area_multiplier
argument.description: Values specify a fraction of the Building America Benchmark return duct surface area.

argument.name: duct_unconditioned_rvalue
argument.description: The nominal R-value for duct insulation.
